alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued July 02 at 2:18AM CDT until July 02 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility around one quarter mile in dense fog. * WHERE...In Minnesota, most of Carlton County and southern St. Louis County near Lake Superior shorelines. In Wisconsin, Douglas, Bayfield and Ashland Counties near Lake Superior shorelines. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Fond du Lac Band, the Bad River Reservation and the Red Cliff Band. * WHEN...Until 8 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility, including the far northern terminus of Interstate 35. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The most dense fog is expected across much of Carlton County, and closer to Lake Superior shoreline areas in southern St. Louis and Douglas, Bayfield and Ashland Counties. Other parts of these counties are still expected to observed pockets of reduced visibility from fog in low-lying basins and valleys.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.
